dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIGroundStationWaypoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStationWaypoint

  • public class DJIGroundStationWaypoint
extends java.lang.Object

    DJI Ground Station Waypoint

    Waypoints are elements of DJIGroundStationTask objects. Each waypoint represents a physical for the aircraft, while a series of waypoints creates a route for the aircraft to follow. Each waypoint contains a DJIGroundStationWayPointAction object. With the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series, actions can be added to each waypoint's action object for the aircraft to execute upon reaching the waypoint. Actions include taking photos, recording video, adjusting the gimbal's pitch and adjusting the aircraft's yaw.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software
    See Also:
    DJIGroundStationTask, DJIGroundStationWayPointAction

    • Field Detail

      • altitude

        public float altitude
        Altitude, in meters, of the aircraft when it reaches the waypoint. The altitude is measured relative to the aircrafts takeoff altitude. The range is [-200, 500].

      • turnMode

        public int turnMode
        turnMode is to be set only when movingMode, of the DJIGroundStationTask class, is set to GSHeadingUsingWaypointHeading, which directs the aircraft to rotate towards a specified heading. The heading is specified in the field heading in this class, DJIGroundStationWaypoint.
        turnMode controls the direction the aircraft rotates in to face towards the specified heading.
        0 - Clockwise
        1 - Anti-Clockwise

      • heading

        public short heading
        Heading, in degrees, of the aircraft when it reaches the waypoint. The range is [-180, 180], where 0 represents true north. Rotating clockwise increases the heading up to 180 degrees, while moving anti-clockwise decreases the heading to a minimum of -180 degrees. Hence, 180 and -180 both represent a heading of true south.

      • speed

        public float speed
        Supported only by the Phantom 2 Series
        Speed, in decimeters (10cm) per second, of the aircraft as it travels towards the waypoint.

      • stayTime

        public short stayTime
        Supported only by the Phantom 2 Series
        The amount of time, in seconds, the aircraft spends at the waypoint. Once the aircraft has spent stayTime seconds at the waypoint, it will continue towards the next waypoint. Range is [0, 999]. Default value is 999.

      • maxReachTime

        public short maxReachTime
        Supported only by the Phantom 2 Series
        Maxiumum amount of time, in seconds, the aircraft can spend travelleling towards the waypoint. If the length of the traversal reaches maxReachTime, the aircraft will skip the waypoint, and proceed directly to the next waypoint. Range is [0, 999]. Default value is 999.

      • actionTimeout

        public short actionTimeout
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        Maximum amount of time, in seconds, the aircraft can spend executing actions at the waypoint. If the aircraft has remained at the waypoint for more than actionTimout seconds it will stop executing its current activity and continue towards the next waypoint. Range is [0, 999]. Default value is 999.

      • dampingDistance

        public float dampingDistance
        Supported only by the Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 Series
        To be specified only when pathMode, in DJIGroundStationTask, is set to TURNING, which directs the aircraft to follow a curved path through the waypoints, rather than a path of straight linesbetween adjacent waypoints.
        dampingDistance controls the curvature of the path. A larger dampingDistance will result in smoother, gentler curves, while a smaller dampingDistance will result in sharper curves. Unit is meters. Range is [0.2, 1000]. Default value is 0.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationPathMode

      • latitude

        public double latitude
        Latitude, in degrees, of the waypoint.

      • longitude

        public double longitude
        Longitude, in degrees, of the waypoint.

      • hasAction

        public boolean hasAction
        A flag to indicate whether there are any actions to be carried out at the waypoint.

      • action

        public DJIGroundStationWayPointAction action
        Structure for DJIGroundStationWayPointAction. DJIGroundStationWayPointAction is a class that contains the waypoint's actions.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWayPointAction

    • Constructor Detail

      • DJIGroundStationWaypoint

        public DJIGroundStationWaypoint(double mLatitude,
                                double mLongitude)
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint constructor function. Allows you to set the longitude and latitude of the waypoint.

        Post Condition:
        A DJIGroundStationWaypoint object will be created. It's latitude and longitudes will be set according to the parameters. DJIGroundStationWayPointAction object will be initiated for the action field, with actionNum = 0 and repeatNum = 1.
        Parameters:
        mLatitude - The waypoint's latitude
        mLongitude - The waypoint's longitude

    • Method Detail

      • addAction

        public boolean addAction(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction action,
                         int parameter)
        Adds an action to the waypoint.

        Pre Condition:
        The waypoint has less than 16 actions.

        Post Condition:
        The waypoint will have an additional action for the aircraft to perform. The index of the added action will be the lowest value available.
        Parameters:
        action - The waypoint action to be added
        parameter - The parameter of the waypoint action. Certain waypoint actions require a parameter to function. For example, the waypoint action Way_Point_Action_Craft_Yaw require you to specify the angle to rotate to.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the action has been succesfully added. Else, if the waypoint already has a maximum of 16 actions, returns false.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction

      • removeAllAction

        public void removeAllAction()
        Removes all actions from the Waypoint.

        Post Condition:
        The waypoint will have no actions. Upon reaching the waypoint, the aircraft will simply continue to the next waypoint.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction

      • removeActionAtIndex

        public boolean removeActionAtIndex(int index)
        Removes action at index.

        Pre Condition:
        There must be an action at the specified index.

        Post Condition:
        All actions of a higher index are shifted down one index. If the removed action was the last action, the index will no longer refer to any action.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the action to be removed
        Returns:
        boolean True if the action has been removed successfully. Else false.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction

      • getActionAtIndex

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction getActionAtIndex(int index)
        Gets the action at the specified index.

        Pre Condition:
        There must be an action at the specified index.

        Post Condition:
        If the index is larger than the number of actions in the Waypoint will return Unknown.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to get the action from
        Returns:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction The action at the index.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction

      • adjustActionAtIndex

        public boolean adjustActionAtIndex(int index,
                                   DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction action,
                                   int parameter)
        Switches the action at the specified index.

        Pre Condition:
        There must be an action at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the action to switch
        action - The new action to switch to
        parameter - The parameter of the waypoint action. Certain waypoint actions require a parameter to function. For example, the waypoint action Way_Point_Action_Craft_Yaw requires you to specify the angle to rotate to.
        Returns:
        boolean False if the index is larger than the number of actions. Else true.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationOnWayPointAction
